meanings.sent1: The math stumper took me hours to solve.
meanings.sent2: The crossword puzzle had a real stumper that I couldn't figure out.
meanings.sent3: The riddle was such a stumper that it left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The stumper of how to fix the broken machine seemed unsolvable.
meanings.sent5: The stumper in the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the very end.

meanings.definition: Something that is puzzling or perplexing.
meanings.sent1: The strange noise coming from the attic was a real stumper.
meanings.sent2: The optical illusion was a stumper for many people.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was a delightful stumper.
meanings.sent4: Her behavior was a stumper to her friends, who couldn't understand why she acted that way.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was a stumper for archaeologists trying to decipher its purpose.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is challenging or difficult to overcome.
meanings.sent1: The champion boxer was a tough stumper for any opponent.
meanings.sent2: The final level of the game was a real stumper that many players struggled with.
meanings.sent3: The massive boulder blocking the path was a stumper for the hikers.
meanings.sent4: The intricate puzzle was a stumper that required patience and focus to complete.
meanings.sent5: The language barrier proved to be a stumper for the travelers trying to communicate with the locals.
